title: Distributed Systems in One Lesson
description: A concise introduction to distributed systems, covering topics like consistency, availability, and scalability.

title: Scaling Reliability at Dropbox
description: Dropbox's journey in improving reliability and scalability, focusing on incident management and system durability.

title: Architecture to Handle 80K RPS Celebrity Sales at Shopify
description: Shopify's infrastructure evolution to handle massive flash sales through pod-based architecture and global traffic management.

title: Building a Distributed Build System at Google Scale
description: Google's evolution of their distributed build system to support 30,000 engineers working on a monolithic codebase with zero downtime migration.

title: Lessons of Scale at Facebook
description: Facebook's journey scaling from 7 million to 400 million users, covering both technical challenges of the social graph and organizational approaches to maintaining speed while growing.

title: Scaling the Backend at YouTube: A Journey Through Massive Growth
description: An exploration of how YouTube evolved its backend architecture to handle billions of users and massive content growth, with practical lessons on incremental scaling, technology choices, and engineering philosophy.
author: YouTube Engineering Team

title: Scaling Databases at Facebook: Engineering Through Hypergrowth
description: Facebook's journey in scaling database systems to handle billions of users, trillions of rows, and petabytes of data while maintaining millisecond response times.

title: Building Resilient Systems at Netflix: Embracing Chaos in the Cloud
description: Netflix's approach to building resilient systems through chaos engineering, microservices architecture, and designing for failure in cloud environments.

title: Scaling Twitter's Distributed Systems: Engineering for the World's Conversation
description: Twitter's evolution from a simple Ruby on Rails application to a sophisticated distributed system capable of handling hundreds of millions of users and sudden traffic spikes.

title: Scaling Spotify's Music Streaming Service: Engineering for 400+ Million Listeners
description: How Spotify evolved from a peer-to-peer architecture to a global streaming platform capable of delivering millions of songs with millisecond latency to hundreds of millions of users.

title: Scaling Shopify's E-commerce Platform: Engineering for Global Commerce
description: Shopify's journey in building a platform that powers over a million online stores, handling billions in transactions and massive traffic spikes during flash sales and Black Friday.

title: Scaling Slack's Real-Time Messaging System: Engineering for Instant Communication
description: How Slack built and scaled their real-time messaging infrastructure to support millions of users with instant message delivery and years of searchable conversation history.

title: Scaling Pinterest to 250 Million Monthly Users: A Visual Journey
description: Pinterest's evolution from a simple stack to a sophisticated platform capable of storing and serving billions of images while providing personalized recommendations to hundreds of millions of users.

title: Scaling Uber's Real-Time Market Platform: Engineering at Global Scale
description: How Uber built a system to match millions of riders with drivers in real-time across hundreds of cities worldwide, calculating dynamic prices and ETAs within milliseconds.

title: Scaling Airbnb's Payment Platform: Building Trust Through Technology
description: Airbnb's journey in building a global payment system that handles transactions in 190+ countries, supports 70+ currencies, and processes billions of dollars annually while navigating complex regulations.
